item.title: 关键证人称 "土拨鼠日 "交易为 Archegos 带来风险
item.description: Archegos 资本管理公司创始人 Bill Hwang 一旦决定了一笔交易，就会再做一次。再来一次一次又一次。资深员工们的反应是互相问候 "土拨鼠日快乐"，这是比尔-莫瑞（Bill Murray）的经典时间循环喜剧。【原文：Once Archegos Capital Management founder Bill Hwang decided on a trade, he did it again. And again. And again. Senior staffers reacted by greeting each other with “Happy Groundhog Day,” a reference to the classic Bill Murray time-loop comedy.】

item.title: 摩根大通的科拉诺维奇是迈克-威尔逊（Mike Wilson）辞职后最后一只著名的 "熊"。
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的迈克-威尔逊（Mike Wilson）周一投降，摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：There’s just one big bear left in Wall Street’s forest of stock market opinions after Morgan Stanley’s Mike Wilson capitulated on Monday while JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Marko Kolanovic held firm in his gloomy outlook on equities.】

item.title: Peloton 启动 10 亿美元贷款，为现有债务再融资
item.description: Peloton Interactive 公司在努力为现有债务再融资并从最近的销售低迷中恢复过来的同时，启动了一笔新贷款的销售。【原文：Peloton Interactive Inc. kicked off the sale of a new loan as it works to refinance existing debt and recover from a recent slump in sales.】

item.title: 纽约大型购物中心的市政债券暂时避免违约
item.description: 惠誉评级公司（Fitch Ratings）认为，与纽约州最大的购物中心 Destiny USA 相关的市政债券很可能会违约，只是不会马上违约。【原文：Municipal bonds tied to Destiny USA, the biggest shopping mall in New York state, will probably default, just not imminently, according to Fitch Ratings.】

item.title: 以太币因 ETF 获批猜测而蹿升，引领加密货币涨势
item.description: 越来越多的人猜测，监管机构对一种或多种直接投资于第二大加密货币的交易所交易基金的反对态度正在缓和，因此以太币大涨，引领了数字资产的反弹。【原文：Ether surged, leading a rally in digital assets, amid growing speculation that opposition is easing among regulators toward one or more exchange-traded funds that invest directly in the second-biggest cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 前纽维安交易员因内幕交易计划获刑 70 个月
item.description: Nuveen 公司的一名前股票交易员承认，他向另一名男子通风报信，将公司的交易作为 4,700 万美元前线操作计划的一部分，因此被判入狱近六年。【原文：A former Nuveen equity trader was ordered to spend almost six years behind bars after admitting he tipped off another man to the firm’s trades as part of a $47 million front-running scheme.】

item.title: 俄罗斯在满足当地需求后暂时允许出口汽油
item.description: 由于国内供应已满足需求，俄罗斯暂时取消了汽油出口禁令，以避免炼油厂库存过多。【原文：Russia temporarily lifted its ban on gasoline exports to avoid overstocking at refineries as domestic supplies have met demand.】

item.title: 力拓宣布澳大利亚氧化铝货物不可抗力
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，力拓集团已经宣布，由于运营所需的天然气短缺，其位于澳大利亚昆士兰州的炼油厂的氧化铝货物将面临不可抗力。【原文：Rio Tinto Group has declared force majeure on alumina cargoes from its refineries in Queensland, Australia, due to shortages of gas to power its operations, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Blackstone 在 10 亿美元交易中给予 Press Ganey 难得的灵活性
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 主导了约 10 亿美元的优先股权投资，为 Press Ganey 的债务再融资提供支持，其中包括罕见的优惠条件，使该公司所有者在未来几个月内更容易出售股权或将业务上市。【原文：Blackstone Inc. led a roughly $1 billion preferred-equity investment backing Press Ganey’s debt refinancing that includes rare concessions that make it easier for the company’s owners to sell a stake or list the business over the coming months.】

item.title: 格雷电视公司启动 10 亿美元债券销售以寻求再融资
item.description: 格雷电视公司计划出售 10 亿美元的高级担保票据，作为早前贷款销售被撤出市场后更广泛再融资努力的一部分。【原文：Gray Television Inc. plans to sell $1 billion in senior secured notes as part of a broader refinancing effort after an earlier loan sale was pulled from the market.】

item.description: 鲍比-贾恩（Bobby Jain）的新对冲基金正在从大宗商品贸易公司挖掘人才，并将募集到的资金中的一大部分投入到原材料领域，包括实物市场。【原文：Bobby Jain’s new hedge fund is tapping talent from commodity trading houses and committing a chunk of the money it’s raising for a major push into raw materials — including in the physical market.】

item.title: 摩根大通称每位新员工都将接受人工智能培训
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）正在对每一位银行业新员工进行人工智能培训，让他们做好准备，迎接这项被首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）比作印刷机和蒸汽机影响的技术。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is immersing every new banking employee in artificial-intelligence training, preparing them for a technology Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon has likened to the impact of the printing press and steam engine.】

item.title: 津巴布韦将启动黄金追踪系统以遏制走私活动

item.title: 纽约 MTA 考虑用成本更低的债务取代 "建设美国 "债券
item.description: 纽约大都会运输局正在考虑将其 37.3 亿美元的应税 "建设美国债券"（Build America Bonds）中的至少一部分偿还为免税债务，尽管一些投资者对此类交易表示反对。【原文：New York’s Metropolitan Transportation Authority is considering refunding at least a portion of its $3.73 billion of taxable Build America Bonds into tax-exempt debt, even as some investors push back against such transactions.】
